examples.en: The team discussed preoperation safety procedures.
examples.zh: 团队讨论了术前安全流程。

extraExplanation: “preoperation”在实际英文里更常见的写法是分开的或加连字符：pre-operation；在医学语境中，更常用、更标准的形容词是“preoperative”（如：preoperative evaluation 术前评估）。如果你是在写论文、病历或说明书，优先考虑用“preoperative”。

summary.en: Preoperational describes the early childhood stage (about ages 2–7) when thinking is symbolic but not yet fully logical.
summary.zh: Preoperational 指儿童早期（约2–7岁）的“前运算阶段”：能进行符号化思考，但逻辑推理尚未成熟。

definition.en: (Psychology) Relating to Piaget’s preoperational stage of cognitive development (about ages 2–7), when children use symbols and language but often think in intuitive, not fully logical ways.
definition.zh: （心理学）与皮亚杰所说的“前运算阶段”有关（约2–7岁）：儿童开始使用符号与语言，但思考多凭直觉，尚未形成成熟的逻辑运算能力。

examples.en: In the preoperational stage, many children struggle to understand that the same amount of water can look different in a taller glass.
examples.zh: 在前运算阶段，很多孩子难以理解：同样多的水换到更高的杯子里看起来变多了，但数量其实不变。

examples.en: The teacher used pictures and pretend play to support preoperational learners.
examples.zh: 老师用图片和角色扮演来支持前运算阶段的学习者。

extraExplanation: “preoperational”最常见于发展心理学与教育学语境，尤其是皮亚杰（Jean Piaget）的认知发展理论。
前运算阶段的典型特点常被用来解释儿童的思维方式，例如：自我中心（较难从他人视角看问题）、聚焦（容易只注意到事物的一个显著特征）、以及对“守恒”（数量、体积等不因外形变化而改变）的理解尚不稳定。
在日常英语里它不算高频词，通常出现在教材、论文、课堂讨论或专业报告中。

summary.en: Preoperative means “before surgery” or “related to the period before an operation.”
summary.zh: preoperative 指“术前的”，即在手术之前或与手术前阶段有关的。

definition.en: Happening or done before a surgical operation; relating to the time before surgery.
definition.zh: 术前的；在手术之前进行的；与手术前阶段有关的。

examples.en: The nurse checked his blood pressure during the preoperative exam.
examples.zh: 护士在术前检查时测量了他的血压。

examples.en: You may need to stop eating and drinking the night before, depending on the preoperative instructions.
examples.zh: 根据术前指示，你可能需要从前一晚开始禁食禁饮。

examples.en: Preoperative tests help doctors plan the safest anesthesia.
examples.zh: 术前检查有助于医生制定最安全的麻醉方案。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：pre- 表示“在……之前”，operative 来自 operate（手术/操作）。因此 preoperative 就是“手术之前的”。
常见搭配：preoperative assessment（术前评估）、preoperative screening/tests（术前筛查/检查）、preoperative instructions（术前注意事项）、preoperative fasting（术前禁食）。
同类词对比：postoperative 是“术后的”；intraoperative 是“术中（手术过程中）的”。

summary.en: “Preoperatively” means “before surgery,” often used in medical contexts.
summary.zh: “Preoperatively”意为“术前/手术前”，常用于医学语境。

definition.en: Before a surgical operation; during the period leading up to surgery.
definition.zh: （在）手术前；指手术前准备阶段。

examples.en: The doctor explained the risks to the patient preoperatively.
examples.zh: 医生在术前向病人解释了风险。

examples.en: Preoperatively, she was asked not to eat or drink after midnight.
examples.zh: 术前，她被要求午夜后不要进食或饮水。

examples.en: Pain levels were recorded preoperatively and again after surgery.
examples.zh: 疼痛程度在术前记录一次，手术后又记录一次。

extraExplanation: 词源与构成：pre-（在……之前）+ operative（手术的/操作的）+ -ly（副词后缀），常见于医学写作与病历记录，与 intraoperatively（术中）和 postoperatively（术后）并列使用。
使用场景：多用于正式语境，如医生沟通、研究论文、护理记录；日常口语里更常说 “before surgery / before the operation”。

summary.en: A preoperator is a prefix operator placed before the operand in programming.
summary.zh: preoperator 指编程中放在操作数前面的前缀运算符。

definition.en: (Programming) An operator written before its operand; a prefix operator (for example, ++i, --i, !x).
definition.zh: （编程）写在操作数前面的运算符；前缀运算符（例如 ++i、--i、!x）。

examples.en: In C++, ++i is a preoperator form of increment.
examples.zh: 在 C++ 中，++i 是自增的前缀（preoperator）写法。

examples.en: A preoperator often changes the value before the expression is evaluated.
examples.zh: 前缀运算符通常会在表达式求值前就改变数值。

extraExplanation: 这个词在一般英语里不常见，更常见的说法是 prefix operator（前缀运算符）或 pre-increment/pre-decrement operator（前置自增/自减运算符）。
以 ++i 和 i++ 为例：前者通常表示“先加再用”，后者通常表示“先用再加”（具体细节取决于语言与上下文）。

summary.en: A fish bone located in front of the gill cover (opercle).
summary.zh: 鱼类鳃盖前方的一块骨板（前鳃盖骨）。

definition.en: A bony plate in many fishes that lies in front of the opercle (the gill cover) and helps support/protect the gill area.
definition.zh: （鱼类）前鳃盖骨：位于鳃盖（鳃盖骨）前方的一块骨板，起到支撑和保护鳃部区域的作用。

examples.en: The biologist examined the fish’s preopercle to help identify the species.
examples.zh: 生物学家检查这条鱼的前鳃盖骨，以帮助鉴定物种。

examples.en: In some fish, the edge of the preopercle has small spines.
examples.zh: 在一些鱼类中，前鳃盖骨的边缘带有小棘刺。

extraExplanation: 词源小提示：pre- 表示“在前”，opercle 指“鳃盖/盖子”（也可泛指盖状结构）。preopercle 字面意思就是“位于鳃盖之前的结构”。
在鱼类形态学与分类学中，前鳃盖骨的形状、边缘锯齿/棘刺、以及与周围骨骼的连接方式，常被用作鉴别特征。

summary.en: Preopercular means “related to the preopercle,” a bone near the gill cover in fish.
summary.zh: preopercular 指“与前鳃盖骨/前鳃盖有关的”，常用于鱼类解剖与分类描述。

definition.en: (Anatomy, especially in fish) relating to the preopercle (also called the preopercular bone), a bone near the gill cover (operculum).
definition.zh: （解剖学，尤指鱼类）与“前鳃盖骨/前鳃盖”（preopercle）有关的；指位于鳃盖（operculum）前方附近的一块骨骼。

examples.en: The specimen has a serrated preopercular margin.
examples.zh: 该标本的前鳃盖骨边缘呈锯齿状。

examples.en: Researchers measured preopercular length to compare related fish species.
examples.zh: 研究人员测量前鳃盖骨长度，以比较近缘鱼类物种。

extraExplanation: 词源拆解有助记忆：pre-（在……之前）+ operculum（鳃盖/盖子）→ preopercular（位于鳃盖之前/与其相关）。
这个词多见于鱼类形态学、分类学论文或鉴定手册中，用来描述“前鳃盖骨”的形状、棘刺、边缘是否锯齿等特征，这些细节常用于区分物种。

summary.en: A fish skull bone in front of the operculum (gill cover).
summary.zh: 鱼类鳃盖前方的一块骨（前鳃盖骨）。

definition.en: In fish anatomy, the bony plate (part of the gill cover) located in front of the operculum; it helps protect and support the gill chamber.
definition.zh: （鱼类解剖）鳃盖骨前部的一块骨板，位于主鳃盖（operculum）之前；用于保护并支撑鳃腔。

examples.en: The biologist examined the preoperculum to identify the fish species.
examples.zh: 生物学家检查了前鳃盖骨，以鉴定鱼的物种。

examples.en: Spines on the preoperculum can be an important feature in field guides.
examples.zh: 前鳃盖骨上的棘突常是野外识别手册中的重要特征。

extraExplanation: 这个词主要用于鱼类学（ichthyology）与解剖学论文或物种鉴定资料中，日常英语里很少见。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ operculum（鳃盖/盖子）。在鱼类头部骨骼中，preoperculum 通常与 operculum、suboperculum、interoperculum 等骨片一起构成“鳃盖骨复合体”（opercular series）。
在分类与鉴定中，研究者常记录前鳃盖骨的形状、边缘是否有锯齿/棘突、以及与相邻骨片的连接方式等特征。

summary.en: A preopinion is an opinion formed in advance—before you have all the facts.
summary.zh: preopinion 指在没有充分事实前就先形成的看法（先入之见/成见）。

definition.en: a prior or already-formed opinion about something before getting full information; a preconception
definition.zh: 先入为主的看法；在了解充分信息之前就形成的意见（成见）

examples.en: Try to set aside your preopinion and listen to both sides.
examples.zh: 尽量放下先入为主的看法，听听双方怎么说。

examples.en: Her preopinion of the new teacher changed after the first class.
examples.zh: 第一节课后，她对新老师的先入为主印象改变了。

extraExplanation: “preopinion”在英语中并不常见，更多时候会用更自然的表达，比如：preconception（成见/先入之见）、preconceived notion（先入为主的观念）、bias（偏见）、assumption（假设）。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ opinion（意见/看法），意思接近“事先的看法”。在正式写作里建议改用上面更常用的词。

summary.en: “Preopinionated” means already having a fixed opinion before hearing the facts—going in with a preconceived view.
summary.zh: “preopinionated”指在了解事实之前就已有定见，带着先入为主的看法。

definition.en: Having a fixed opinion before hearing the facts or other people’s views; already decided in advance.
definition.zh: 在了解事实或听取他人观点之前就已有定见的；先入为主的。

examples.en: Try not to be preopinionated—listen to both sides first.
examples.zh: 尽量别先入为主——先把双方的说法都听完。

examples.en: The interviewer seemed preopinionated and didn’t ask many follow-up questions.
examples.zh: 那位面试官看起来已经带着成见，所以没怎么追问。

examples.en: If you go in preopinionated, you may miss important details.
examples.zh: 如果你带着先入为主的想法进入讨论，你可能会错过重要细节。

extraExplanation: “preopinionated”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的表达是 **opinionated**（很有主见/固执己见）、**prejudiced**（有偏见的）、**biased**（有倾向性的）或 **with preconceived notions**（带着先入为主的观念）。
构词理解：**pre-** 表示“在……之前”，**opinionated** 表示“强烈坚持自己观点的”。合起来就是“事先就持有强烈看法”，语气往往带批评意味。

summary.en: To oppose something beforehand; to object in advance.
summary.zh: 在事情发生前就反对；事先提出反对。

definition.en: to oppose (a plan, idea, or action) in advance; to object beforehand
definition.zh: 预先反对；事先提出反对（某计划、想法或行动）

examples.en: Several members preopposed the proposal before the meeting even started.
examples.zh: 会议还没开始，一些成员就预先反对了这项提案。

examples.en: It’s hard to negotiate if one side preopposes every change.
examples.zh: 如果一方对每个改动都事先反对，协商就很难进行。

extraExplanation: “preoppose”很少见，更多时候英语会用更自然的表达：**oppose in advance / object beforehand / raise objections early**。
词形来自前缀 **pre-**（“在……之前”）+ **oppose**（“反对”）。在正式写作中，为了清晰，常建议改写为上述更常用的短语。

summary.en: “Preopposed” means already opposed in advance—showing objection before something is fully considered.
summary.zh: “preopposed”指“事先就反对的”，强调在充分了解或讨论前就先持反对立场。

definition.en: already opposed in advance; having a prior objection before something is fully presented or tried
definition.zh: 事先就反对的；在事情充分提出或尝试之前就先持反对立场的

examples.en: Some people are preopposed to any new taxes, even before they hear the details.
examples.zh: 有些人对任何新税收都事先反对，甚至在听到细节之前就先否定了。

examples.en: If the committee is preopposed, you’ll need stronger evidence to change minds.
examples.zh: 如果委员会事先就反对，你就需要更有力的证据来改变他们的想法。

definition.en: past form/past participle of “preoppose”: to oppose beforehand or in anticipation
definition.zh: “preoppose”的过去式/过去分词：预先反对；事先表示反对

examples.en: Several groups preopposed the proposal months before the public meeting.
examples.zh: 在公开会议前几个月，已有几个团体预先反对该提案。

extraExplanation: “preopposed”不算常见词，更常见的表达是：be opposed from the start（从一开始就反对）、be predisposed to oppose（倾向于反对）、have a preconceived objection（先入为主地反对）。
构词上由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ opposed（反对的）组成，强调“反对发生得很早、带有预设立场”。在正式写作里使用时，通常需要上下文说明你指的是“提前反对/先入为主的反对”。

summary.en: “Preopposing” means opposing something in advance (a rare word).
summary.zh: “preopposing”表示“事先反对”（较罕用的词）。

definition.en: (Rare) opposing something in advance; showing opposition before an event, action, or proposal happens.
definition.zh: （罕用）事先反对的；在某事发生、行动开始或提案提出之前就表示反对的。

examples.en: Some community groups were preopposing the plan before the official meeting even began.
examples.zh: 有些社区团体在正式会议开始之前就已经在事先反对这个计划。

examples.en: Preopposing criticism can make honest discussion difficult.
examples.zh: 事先反对式的批评会让坦诚的讨论变得困难。

definition.en: the present participle of the rare verb “preoppose”: to oppose in advance.
definition.zh: 罕用动词 preoppose 的现在分词：指事先反对。

examples.en: They are preopposing any change to the schedule.
examples.zh: 他们正在事先反对对日程安排的任何改动。

extraExplanation: “preopposing / preoppose”在现代英语中非常少见，更自然的表达通常是“oppose in advance”“preemptively oppose”“be against it from the start”。
书面语中也常见带连字符的写法“pre-opposing”，用来强调“pre-（事先）+ opposing（反对）”的构词关系。

summary.en: A rare word meaning “before opposition,” used for a stage or situation prior to open disagreement.
summary.zh: 一个较少见的词，意思是“反对出现之前”，指公开分歧发生前的阶段或情境。

definition.en: (Rare) The period or situation before open opposition begins; a stage before people publicly disagree or resist.
definition.zh: （罕见）公开反对开始之前的时期或情境；在人们公开表达反对或抵制之前的阶段。

examples.en: In the preopposition phase, the team raised concerns quietly instead of arguing in meetings.
examples.zh: 在公开反对之前的阶段，团队只是私下提出担忧，而不是在会议上争论。

examples.en: The report describes preopposition tensions inside the organization.
examples.zh: 这份报告描述了组织内部在公开反对出现之前的紧张气氛。

definition.en: (Rare) Happening before opposition forms or is expressed.
definition.zh: （罕见）发生在反对意见形成或被表达之前的。

examples.en: They held a preopposition discussion to prevent conflict later.
examples.zh: 他们举行了一次“反对出现之前”的讨论，以避免之后的冲突。

examples.en: Preopposition signals can be easy to miss.
examples.zh: 反对出现之前的信号很容易被忽略。

extraExplanation: “preopposition”不是常见标准词，写作中很少见；更多时候人们会用更自然的表达，如 “before opposition arose / prior to opposition / pre-opposition stage”。
它也很容易被误写成 “preposition”（介词）。如果你原本想查的是 “preposition”，告诉我语境（句子或主题），我可以按“介词”给出标准释义与用法。

summary.en: “Preoppress” is not standard English; it’s probably a typo for “oppress” or “pre-op.”
summary.zh: “preoppress”不是标准英语词；多半是把“oppress”或“pre-op”拼错了。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it is likely a misspelling or a made-up form. You may have meant “oppress” or “pre-op” (short for preoperative).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；很可能是拼写错误或自造词。你可能想写的是“oppress（压迫）”或“pre-op（术前的/术前检查的）”。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “preoppress” in a dictionary—did you mean “oppress”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“preoppress”——你是不是想写“oppress”？

examples.en: The nurse explained the pre-op instructions before surgery.
examples.zh: 护士在手术前解释了术前（pre-op）注意事项。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前”（例如 prewar 战前，prepaid 预付）。理论上把 pre- 加在动词前有时能造出新词，但“preoppress”并不是约定俗成的用法，因此读者通常会认为是拼写错误。
如果你想表达“在某事发生前就进行压迫/打压”，更自然的说法包括：“oppress in advance”“preemptively suppress”“crack down before …”。
如果你告诉我你的原句（上下文），我可以帮你判断你真正想用的词，并给出更地道的改写。

summary.en: “Preoppression” is a rare form meaning the time before oppression; “pre-oppression” is the clearer, more common spelling.
summary.zh: “preoppression”很少见，意思是“压迫发生之前的时期/状态”；更清晰常见的写法是“pre-oppression”。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) The period or condition before oppression begins; “pre-oppression” is more commonly written with a hyphen.
definition.zh: （罕见/不规范用法）指压迫开始之前的时期或状态；更常见写法为带连字符的“pre-oppression”。

examples.en: The novel’s first chapters describe a pre-oppression era, when the community still had basic rights.
examples.zh: 这部小说的前几章描写了一个“压迫之前”的时代，那时社区仍享有基本权利。

examples.en: Activists studied pre-oppression social structures to understand what was lost later.
examples.zh: 活动人士研究“压迫前”的社会结构，以理解后来失去了什么。

extraExplanation: “preoppression”在现代英语中非常少见，读者可能会以为是拼写错误。更自然的写法通常是“pre-oppression”（带连字符），或直接用“before the oppression / prior to oppression”。
前缀“pre-”表示“在……之前”（如 prewar 战前、preindustrial 工业化前）。与抽象名词“oppression（压迫）”组合时，加连字符能让结构更清晰、可读性更高。

summary.en: “Preoppressor” is rare and nonstandard; it usually means a potential future oppressor, or it may be a misspelling of “oppressor.”
summary.zh: “preoppressor”很罕见且不标准：多指“潜在的未来压迫者”，也可能只是把“oppressor（压迫者）”拼错了。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) A person or group seen as a likely future oppressor; a “would-be oppressor” before they gain power.
definition.zh: （罕见／非标准用法）指被认为将来可能成为压迫者的人或群体；还未掌权时的“潜在压迫者”。

examples.en: Some activists warned that the militia was a preoppressor, already testing how far it could control people.
examples.zh: 一些行动者警告说，这支民兵是“潜在压迫者”，已经在试探能把人控制到什么程度。

examples.en: He argued that unchecked authority can turn a preoppressor into an oppressor.
examples.zh: 他认为，不受约束的权力会让“潜在压迫者”变成真正的压迫者。

definition.en: (Likely intended meaning) A misspelling or mistaken form of “oppressor.”
definition.zh: （更可能的情况）“oppressor（压迫者）”的拼写错误或误写形式。

examples.en: If you mean “oppressor,” the spelling is o-p-p-r-e-s-s-o-r.
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“压迫者”，拼写是 o-p-p-r-e-s-s-o-r。

examples.en: In that sentence, “oppressor” fits the meaning better than “preoppressor.”
examples.zh: 在那个句子里，用“oppressor”比“preoppressor”更符合意思。

extraExplanation: “preoppressor”不是常见英语词，通常需要连字符写成“pre-oppressor”才更容易被读者理解，意思类似“would-be oppressor / potential oppressor”。
如果你是在历史、政治或社会批评语境中看到它，往往是作者刻意造词，用来强调“压迫尚未发生，但条件与倾向已经出现”。
如果你提供原句，我可以帮你判断这里究竟是在造词（pre-oppressor）还是单纯把“oppressor”拼错了。

summary.en: Preoptic describes the brain region in front of the optic chiasm (the preoptic area), important for temperature, sleep, and reproductive control.
summary.zh: preoptic 指位于视交叉前方的脑区（下丘脑视前区），与体温、睡眠及生殖调控密切相关。

definition.en: Relating to the area in front of the optic chiasm in the brain (the preoptic area of the hypothalamus), involved in functions such as body temperature regulation, sleep, and reproduction.
definition.zh: 与大脑中视交叉前方的区域有关（下丘脑的视前区），该区域参与体温调节、睡眠与生殖等功能。

examples.en: Researchers studied preoptic neurons to understand how the body controls temperature.
examples.zh: 研究人员研究视前区神经元，以了解身体如何控制体温。

examples.en: The preoptic area plays an important role in sleep regulation.
examples.zh: 视前区在睡眠调节中起重要作用。

synonyms: anterior to the optic chiasm (descriptive phrase)
extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/前方”，“optic”与“视觉/视神经”有关；因此preoptic字面意思是“视（觉）之前的/视前的”。
在医学与神经科学文献中，preoptic通常特指“下丘脑视前区（preoptic area）”，而不是泛指“眼睛前方”。

summary.en: Preoptimistic describes a stage before optimism—when someone is not yet hopeful or confident.
summary.zh: preoptimistic 表示“乐观之前的阶段”，指还没变得乐观、尚未产生希望或信心。

definition.en: Existing or happening before a person or group becomes optimistic; describing an earlier stage when hope or confidence has not yet developed.
definition.zh: 发生在变得乐观之前的；描述尚未产生希望或信心的较早阶段。

examples.en: In the preoptimistic days of the project, the team focused on risks and worst-case scenarios.
examples.zh: 在项目的“乐观之前”阶段，团队主要关注风险和最坏情况。

examples.en: Her preoptimistic mood changed after she saw the test results improve.
examples.zh: 看到测试结果变好后，她那种“尚未乐观”的情绪就改变了。

definition.en: Used more loosely to mean "not yet optimistic" or "skeptical/uncertain" (often in informal or creative writing).
definition.zh: 较宽泛地表示“还不乐观 / 未到乐观的时候”，带有怀疑或不确定的含义（常见于非正式或创意写作）。

examples.en: I’m still preoptimistic about the economy—let’s wait for more data.
examples.zh: 我对经济形势现在还不太乐观——再等等更多数据。

extraExplanation: “preoptimistic”不是常见词，更像是由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ optimistic（“乐观的”）临时组合出来的写法。正式写作中更常用 not yet optimistic、cautious、uncertain、skeptical 等表达。
语境提示：它通常用于描述“情绪/判断从谨慎或担忧逐渐转向乐观”的过程，因此常与阶段性词汇连用，如 phase, period, days, mindset。

summary.en: Preoption means a prior right to buy or choose something before others, especially in legal or business contexts.
summary.zh: Preoption 指在他人之前享有购买或选择某物的优先权，常见于法律或商业语境。

definition.en: A prior right to buy, take, or choose something before other people; a right of first refusal (often in law or business).
definition.zh: 优先购买/优先选择权；先买权（多用于法律或商业语境，类似“优先承购权/优先权”）

examples.en: The contract gives the tenant a preoption to buy the apartment if the owner decides to sell.
examples.zh: 合同赋予房客在房主决定出售时优先购买公寓的权利。

examples.en: Investors asked for a preoption on any new shares issued by the company.
examples.zh: 投资者要求对公司未来发行的新股享有优先认购权。

definition.en: A preliminary agreement that grants someone the chance to enter a later, formal option contract (finance).
definition.zh: （金融）预先期权安排：允许一方在之后签订正式期权合约的初步协议

examples.en: They signed a preoption so the buyer could decide later whether to purchase at a fixed price.
examples.zh: 他们签了预先期权协议，让买方之后再决定是否按固定价格购买。

extraExplanation: “preoption”在现代英语中相对少见，很多场合更常用的是“right of first refusal（优先购买权）”或“pre-emption right（优先认购权/先买权）”。
拼写上也容易与“preemption/pre-emption（先占、先买权）”混淆；如果你是在法律条款或公司融资文件里看到它，通常是在表达“别人之前你有优先权”。

summary.en: Preoral means “in front of the mouth” or “before oral activity,” mainly in scientific contexts.
summary.zh: preoral 主要指“口前的/在口之前的”，多用于科学与医学相关语境，也可少见地指“口腔活动之前的”。

definition.en: Located in front of the mouth; occurring before the mouth (used in anatomy or zoology).
definition.zh: （解剖学/动物学）位于口部前方的；发生在口之前的。

examples.en: In some fish, the preoral region includes structures used to sense food.
examples.zh: 在一些鱼类中，口前区域（preoral region）包含用于感知食物的结构。

examples.en: The diagram labels the preoral area just ahead of the mouth opening.
examples.zh: 图示把口前区标注在口开口的正前方。

definition.en: Relating to a stage or condition before oral activity (rare; sometimes seen in developmental or clinical writing).
definition.zh: （少见；有时用于发展/临床语境）与口腔活动之前的阶段或状态有关的。

examples.en: The author briefly mentions a preoral phase before feeding behaviors become oral.
examples.zh: 作者简要提到在进食行为变为口腔主导之前存在一个“口前阶段”。

extraExplanation: pre- 表示“在……之前”，oral 表示“口的/口腔的”。因此 preoral 字面意思是“在口之前/口前的”。它更常见于解剖学、动物学或胚胎发育相关的专业语境，日常英语中很少用。
更常见、更自然的替代表达包括：in front of the mouth（在口前）、anterior to the mouth（在口的前方/前侧，偏学术）。

summary.en: “Preorally” means “before something is taken by mouth,” mainly in medical/scientific contexts.
summary.zh: “Preorally” 指“在经口（口服/吞咽）之前”，主要用于医学或科研语境。

definition.en: Before something is taken or given by mouth; prior to oral administration or ingestion (used mainly in medical or scientific writing).
definition.zh: 在经口（口服/吞咽）之前；在进行口服给药或经口摄入之前（多用于医学或科研语境）。

examples.en: The medication was given intravenously preorally to control the patient’s nausea.
examples.zh: 为控制患者恶心，在口服之前先静脉给药。

examples.en: Researchers collected baseline saliva samples preorally, before participants swallowed the solution.
examples.zh: 研究人员在受试者吞咽溶液之前（经口之前）先采集了基础唾液样本。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多出现在医学/药理或实验流程描述中，意思是“在口服/吞咽之前”。日常英语里更常用的写法是 before oral administration / prior to taking it by mouth，或用形容词 pre-oral（例如 pre-oral phase）。
在写作中有时也会写成 pre-orally（加连字符），但并非固定标准；正式稿件建议根据期刊/机构的格式指南统一用法。

summary.en: Preorbital means “in front of the eye socket.”
summary.zh: preorbital 指“位于眼眶（眼窝）前方的”。

definition.en: (Anatomy) Located in front of the orbit (the eye socket).
definition.zh: （解剖）位于眼眶（眼窝）前方的。

examples.en: The doctor noted mild swelling in the preorbital area.
examples.zh: 医生注意到眼眶前区有轻微肿胀。

examples.en: Preorbital pain can sometimes be linked to sinus problems.
examples.zh: 眼眶前部疼痛有时与鼻窦问题有关。

extraExplanation: 该词多用于医学/解剖语境：orbit 指“眼眶（眼窝）”，pre- 表示“在……之前/前面”，所以 preorbital 就是“眼眶前的”。日常英语里不常用，更多见于体格检查、影像学报告或动物解剖描述中。

summary.en: Preordain means to decide or set something in advance, often implying it is fated or unavoidable; it can also be used in religious contexts to mean “predestine.”
summary.zh: preordain 指“预先决定/预定”，常带“仿佛命中注定、难以改变”的含义；也可用于宗教语境指“（上帝）预定/命定”。

definition.en: To decide or determine something in advance, often suggesting that it cannot be changed.
definition.zh: 预先决定；预定（常含“无法改变”的意味）。

examples.en: Some people believe our lives are preordained by fate.
examples.zh: 有些人相信我们的生命是由命运预定的。

examples.en: It seemed preordained that she would become a musician, given her talent.
examples.zh: 考虑到她的天赋，她似乎注定会成为音乐家。

definition.en: (In religious use) To predestine someone or something, especially by God’s will.
definition.zh: （宗教用法）预定（尤指上帝的旨意）；命定。

examples.en: The preacher spoke about souls preordained for salvation.
examples.zh: 牧师谈到被预定得救的灵魂。

examples.en: In some traditions, events are seen as preordained by a divine plan.
examples.zh: 在某些传统中，人们认为事件是由神圣计划所预定的。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“提前”，而“ordain”原意与“任命、制定（规则）”有关，因此 preordain 有“提前安排/命定”的语感。
日常语境里它常带有文学或略正式的色彩，强调“仿佛早就注定”，比 decide earlier 更有“不可避免”的宿命感。
常见搭配：preordained destiny（注定的命运）、preordained outcome（预定的结果）。相关词：predestine（宿命论色彩更强）、foreordain（更偏宗教/正式）。

summary.en: Preordained means decided in advance, often with a sense of destiny or divine plan.
summary.zh: preordained 指“预先注定的”，常带“命运或神意安排”的语感。

definition.en: Decided or set in advance, as if by fate or a higher power; destined to happen.
definition.zh: 预先注定的；（仿佛由命运或更高力量）事先决定必然发生的。

examples.en: Some people believe that our lives are preordained by fate.
examples.zh: 有些人相信我们的人生是由命运预先注定的。

examples.en: In the novel, their meeting feels preordained, not accidental.
examples.zh: 在小说里，他们的相遇显得像是命中注定，而不是偶然。

examples.en: She refused to accept that failure was preordained.
examples.zh: 她拒绝接受失败是注定的。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：pre- 表示“在……之前”，ordain 原意有“任命、制定（规则）”，在宗教语境里也有“按神意安排”的含义。因此 preordained 常带有“冥冥之中被安排好”的色彩。
语用提醒：它常用于谈论“命运/宿命”（destiny/fate）或“神的安排”（God’s plan）。如果只是“提前计划好”，更中性、日常的词通常是 planned、scheduled 或 arranged。
文学/文化常见用法：在爱情叙事或史诗式故事里，preordained 常用来营造“天意/宿命感”，强调事件似乎不可避免。

summary.en: Preordaining means deciding or determining something in advance—sometimes in a religious sense of fate being set by divine will.
summary.zh: preordaining 指“预先决定/预定”，有时带宗教含义，表示命运由神意预定。

definition.en: Deciding or arranging something in advance, especially in a way that makes it seem certain to happen.
definition.zh: 预先决定或安排某事（常暗示结果几乎注定会发生）。

examples.en: The early funding is preordaining the project’s success.
examples.zh: 早期的资金支持几乎注定了这个项目会成功。

examples.en: By choosing that major, she felt she was preordaining her future career.
examples.zh: 选择那个专业后，她觉得自己在预先决定未来的职业方向。

definition.en: (Religious) Determining someone’s fate in advance by God or a divine power.
definition.zh: （宗教语境）由上帝或神圣力量预定某人的命运。

examples.en: Some traditions teach that God is preordaining who will be saved.
examples.zh: 一些传统教义认为，上帝预定哪些人会得救。

examples.en: The poem suggests an unseen hand preordaining their meeting.
examples.zh: 这首诗暗示有一只看不见的手在预定他们的相遇。

extraExplanation: “preordain”由“pre-（预先）+ ordain（任命、规定）”组成。现代英语里，它既可用于日常语境（强调“事情几乎不可避免/早已被安排好”），也常用于宗教或哲学语境（强调“命运/救赎被预定”）。
语气上，“preordaining”往往带有“不是偶然，而是早有安排”的感觉；若你想表达更中性、更少宿命色彩，可以用“planning”或“deciding in advance”。

summary.en: Preordainment means that someone’s fate or events are decided in advance, often by God.
summary.zh: preordainment 指命运或事件在事前已被决定（常带有神意预定的含义）。

definition.en: the act or idea that events or a person’s fate have been decided in advance (often by God or a higher power); predestination
definition.zh: 预先决定（常指由上帝或更高力量决定）的行为或观念；宿命、预定

examples.en: In some religious traditions, salvation is seen as a matter of preordainment.
examples.zh: 在一些宗教传统中，得救被看作是预定（预先决定）的结果。

examples.en: He struggled with the idea of preordainment versus free will.
examples.zh: 他在“预定”与“自由意志”的观念之间感到挣扎。

extraExplanation: “preordainment”多见于宗教或哲学语境，语气通常比“plan（计划）”更强，强调“在你行动之前就已注定”。日常英语里更常用“predestination（宿命/预定）”或“preordination”。
词源上由“pre-（预先）+ ordain（任命/规定/授予神圣职分）”构成，因此它常带有“神意安排、神圣命定”的色彩。

summary.en: “Preordains” means “decides in advance; predestines.”
summary.zh: “preordains”意为“预先决定；注定”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of preordain) to decide or arrange something in advance, as if by fate or a higher power.
definition.zh: （preordain 的第三人称单数）预先决定；（仿佛由命运或更高力量）注定。

examples.en: Some people believe God preordains every event in our lives.
examples.zh: 有些人相信上帝预先安排了我们生命中的每一件事。

examples.en: The story suggests that fate preordains the hero’s final choice.
examples.zh: 这个故事暗示命运早已注定了英雄最后的选择。

examples.en: She refuses to think that her future is preordained; she wants to shape it herself.
examples.zh: 她拒绝认为自己的未来是注定的；她想靠自己去塑造。

extraExplanation: “preordain”常见于宗教或哲学语境，尤其与“predestination（预定论）”相关：强调人的命运或结局在出生前就已被决定。日常写作中也可较文学化地表示“似乎早已注定”。

summary.en: “Preorder” means ordering something before it is officially released; it can be a verb (to preorder) or a noun (a preorder).
summary.zh: “preorder”指在商品正式发售前预订/提前下单；既可作动词（预订），也可作名词（预购订单）。

definition.en: to order (a product) in advance before it is available for general sale
definition.zh: （在商品正式发售前）预订、提前下单

examples.en: You can preorder the new phone today, and it ships next month.
examples.zh: 你今天就可以预订这款新手机，下个月发货。

examples.en: I preordered the book so I’ll get it on release day.
examples.zh: 我预订了这本书，这样发售当天就能拿到。

definition.en: an order placed in advance for a product not yet released
definition.zh: 预购订单；预订（尚未发售的商品）

examples.en: The game has thousands of preorders already.
examples.zh: 这款游戏已经有成千上万的预购订单了。

examples.en: Your preorder includes a bonus item.
examples.zh: 你的预购包含一个赠品。

extraExplanation: “preorder”常见于电商、游戏、电影票、演唱会等语境。预订通常会涉及：定金/全款、预计发货或到货时间、取消与退款规则（不同平台差异很大）。
拼写上也常见作“pre-order”（带连字符），意思相同；作动词用“to preorder”，作名词用“a preorder”。

summary.en: “Preordered” means someone already placed an advance order for something before it’s released.
summary.zh: “preordered”表示某物在正式发售/上市前已经被提前下单预订了。

definition.en: Past tense / past participle of “preorder”: to order something before it is officially available (often online).
definition.zh: “preorder”的过去式/过去分词：在商品正式上市或发售前（常见于线上）提前下单预订。

examples.en: I preordered the new game months ago.
examples.zh: 我几个月前就预订了那款新游戏。

examples.en: The phones were preordered online before the launch event.
examples.zh: 这些手机在发布会之前就已在网上被预订了。

definition.en: (Adjective) Already ordered in advance; reserved by ordering before release.
definition.zh: （形容词）已提前下单预订的；预售前已订购的。

examples.en: Your preordered copy will ship on release day.
examples.zh: 你预订的那份会在发售当天发货。

examples.en: Preordered items may arrive later than expected due to high demand.
examples.zh: 由于需求量大，预订商品可能会比预期更晚到货。

extraExplanation: 在电商和游戏/数码产品领域，“preorder（预订/预购）”很常见：商家用它来估算销量、安排生产与库存。预订通常可能包含“定金/全款”“发售日发货”“限量赠品”等条款，购买前可以留意取消政策（cancellation policy）与预计发货时间（estimated shipping date）。

summary.en: Preordering means ordering something in advance (or the advance order itself).
summary.zh: preordering 指提前预订/预购（或指该预购订单本身）。

definition.en: to order (something) in advance, often before it is officially available
definition.zh: （在正式上市或可获得之前）预订、提前下单

examples.en: I’m preordering the new game so I can play it on release day.
examples.zh: 我在预订这款新游戏，这样发售当天就能玩。

examples.en: Many fans preordered tickets months before the concert.
examples.zh: 很多粉丝在演唱会前几个月就预订了门票。

definition.en: an order placed in advance for something that will be available later
definition.zh: 预购订单；预订（指提前下的订单）

examples.en: The phone already has a million preorders.
examples.zh: 这款手机已经有一百万个预购订单了。

examples.en: Your preorder will ship next week.
examples.zh: 你的预购订单下周发货。

extraExplanation: “preorder / pre-order”常见于电商、游戏、电影票、演唱会门票等场景。口语里也会说“place a preorder”（下预购单）或“available for preorder”（开放预订）。
写法上“preorder”“pre-order”都常见；作名词时常用复数“preorders”。

summary.en: Preordinance is a rare noun meaning “preordination/predestination”—something decided in advance, often by God.
summary.zh: Preordinance 是罕见名词，意为“预先决定/预定（宿命）”，常见于宗教语境。

definition.en: (Rare; often considered a misspelling or variant of “preordination”) the act of deciding or arranging something in advance, especially by God; predestination.
definition.zh: （罕见；常被视为“preordination”的拼写变体）预先决定或预先安排（尤指上帝的安排）；宿命、预定。

examples.en: In some religious writings, preordinance is used to mean that God has already planned a person’s fate.
examples.zh: 在一些宗教著作中，preordinance 用来表示上帝已预先安排人的命运。

examples.en: They debated whether human choice can exist alongside preordinance.
examples.zh: 他们讨论人的选择是否能与预定（preordinance）并存。

extraExplanation: “Preordinance”在现代英语中非常少见，更多情况下你会看到 **preordination** 或 **predestination**。在神学语境（如加尔文主义相关讨论）里，它通常指“上帝预先拣选/预定”。
不要把它和 **ordinance**（法令；条例）混淆：ordinance 更偏法律/规章；preordinance/preordination 更偏“预先决定（常带宗教意味）”。

summary.en: Preordination means being decided in advance—especially in theology, God’s prior decision about events or salvation.
summary.zh: Preordination 指“预先定下、预先决定”，尤指神学中上帝对事件或得救与否的预先决定（预定论）。

definition.en: (In theology) the belief that God decided in advance what would happen, especially who would be saved; predestination.
definition.zh: （神学）预先定命；上帝预先决定将发生什么，尤指谁将得救（即“预定论”）。

examples.en: In some Christian traditions, preordination means that God chooses who will be saved.
examples.zh: 在一些基督教传统中，“preordination”指上帝拣选谁将得救。

examples.en: The debate about preordination and free will has lasted for centuries.
examples.zh: 关于预先定命与自由意志的争论持续了几个世纪。

definition.en: The act of deciding or arranging something in advance; prior planning or determination.
definition.zh: 预先决定；预先安排（指提前作出的决定或规划）。

examples.en: The outcome felt like preordination rather than coincidence.
examples.zh: 这个结果让人感觉像是早已注定，而不是巧合。

examples.en: They rejected the idea of preordination and argued that choices shape a person’s life.
examples.zh: 他们反对“预先注定”的观念，认为选择塑造人生。

extraExplanation: 该词常见于宗教与哲学语境，尤其与“predestination（预定论）”紧密相关。日常英语里更常用 predestination；preordination 略显正式、书面或神学色彩更强。
构词上，pre- 表示“预先”，ordination 来自“安排/任命/制定秩序”的含义，因此整体有“预先安排、预先定下”的感觉。

summary.en: Preorganic means “before life/organic organisms existed,” especially in discussions of early Earth or origin-of-life chemistry.
summary.zh: preorganic 指“有机生命出现之前的”，常用于早期地球或生命起源化学等语境。

definition.en: Existing or happening before life (organic organisms) appeared; relating to Earth’s early, lifeless stage.
definition.zh: 有机生命出现之前的；与地球早期无生命阶段有关的。

examples.en: Scientists study preorganic Earth to understand how life could begin.
examples.zh: 科学家研究前有机生命时期的地球，以了解生命如何可能起源。

examples.en: Some rocks preserve chemical clues from a preorganic environment.
examples.zh: 一些岩石保留了来自前有机环境的化学线索。

definition.en: (Chemistry) Referring to chemical conditions or reactions that occur before organic compounds or biological systems form; often similar in meaning to “prebiotic.”
definition.zh: （化学）指在有机化合物或生物系统形成之前的化学条件或反应；常与“prebiotic（生命起源前的）”含义相近。

examples.en: The experiment modeled preorganic chemistry in the early ocean.
examples.zh: 该实验模拟了早期海洋中的前有机化学过程。

examples.en: Researchers compared preorganic reactions with later, life-driven processes.
examples.zh: 研究人员将前有机反应与后期由生命驱动的过程进行比较。

extraExplanation: “preorganic”在现代日常英语中很少见，更多出现在地质学、天体生物学（astrobiology）和生命起源研究的学术语境里。
写作中更常见的替代词是“prebiotic（生命出现之前的）”“primordial（原始的、早期的）”或“abiotic（非生物的）”。选择哪个词取决于你强调的是“生命前的化学”（prebiotic/preorganic）还是“非生物因素”（abiotic）。

summary.en: Preorganically means “before organic matter or life forms existed,” mainly used in scientific contexts.
summary.zh: preorganically 指“在有机物或生命出现之前”，主要用于科学语境。

definition.en: In a way that happens before organic matter, living organisms, or organic development exists or forms.
definition.zh: 以（在）有机物、生命体或有机发展出现/形成之前的方式；在前有机阶段地。

examples.en: Some scientists discuss how Earth’s atmosphere may have changed preorganically, before life began.
examples.zh: 一些科学家讨论地球大气在前有机阶段如何变化，也就是生命开始之前。

examples.en: The experiment aims to model preorganically produced molecules under early-Earth conditions.
examples.zh: 该实验旨在模拟早期地球条件下前有机阶段生成的分子。

extraExplanation: “preorganically”不是日常英语高频词，更多见于学术语境，尤其是生命起源研究（origin of life）、前生物化学（prebiotic chemistry）、地质与行星科学等领域，用来强调“在生命/有机系统出现之前”的时间阶段或过程。
词形上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ organically（以有机方式/在有机体系中）。在写作中常与 before life began、early Earth、prebiotic 等词搭配。

summary.en: Preorganization means organizing in advance; in science, it also means a structure already arranged to bind or react efficiently.
summary.zh: Preorganization 指“预先组织”；在科学语境中也指“在结合或反应前就已排列好的有利结构”。

definition.en: the act of organizing something in advance; planning structures, roles, or steps before the main work begins
definition.zh: 预先组织；在正式开始前先把结构、角色或步骤安排好

examples.en: Good preorganization made the event run smoothly.
examples.zh: 良好的预先组织让活动进行得很顺利。

examples.en: The team focused on preorganization—setting deadlines and assigning tasks—before writing the report.
examples.zh: 团队在写报告前先做预先组织——设定截止日期并分配任务。

definition.en: (especially in chemistry/biology) a structure that is already arranged in a useful shape before binding or reacting, making interaction easier and more efficient
definition.zh: （尤用于化学/生物）预组织状态；在结合或反应前就已排列成有利构型，从而更容易、更高效地相互作用

examples.en: Preorganization of the molecule helps it bind strongly to the target.
examples.zh: 分子的预组织状态帮助它与靶标更牢固地结合。

examples.en: Researchers design receptors with preorganization to improve selectivity.
examples.zh: 研究人员设计具有预组织特征的受体，以提高选择性。

extraExplanation: 在日常英语里，preorganization 比较少见，更常用的是 pre-planning（预先规划）、advance planning（提前规划）或 preparation（准备工作）。
在超分子化学（supramolecular chemistry）中，preorganization 是一个常用概念：如果受体/主体分子在结合前就“预先摆好姿势”，通常会减少构象变化带来的能量代价，从而提升结合强度与选择性。

summary.en: Preorganize means to organize something ahead of time.
summary.zh: preorganize 指“提前把事情组织/整理好”。

definition.en: to organize or arrange something in advance, before an event or task begins
definition.zh: 在开始之前预先组织、安排（某事）

examples.en: Let’s preorganize the files so we can work faster tomorrow.
examples.zh: 我们先把文件预先整理好，这样明天就能更快工作。

examples.en: The teacher preorganized the materials for the group activity.
examples.zh: 老师为小组活动提前把材料准备并分好类。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前/预先”。因此 preorganize = pre-（预先）+ organize（组织、整理）。在正式写作中，更常见的表达是 “organize in advance / plan ahead / prepare in advance”。

summary.en: Preorganized means prepared and organized ahead of time.
summary.zh: preorganized 指“提前准备并整理好的”。

definition.en: arranged, planned, or structured in advance (before something happens), so it is ready to use or follow.
definition.zh: 事先组织好的；预先安排/规划好的（在事情发生前就已准备就绪）。

examples.en: The workshop includes preorganized activities, so participants can start right away.
examples.zh: 这次工作坊包含预先安排好的活动，因此参与者可以立刻开始。

examples.en: She brought a preorganized folder with all the documents labeled by date.
examples.zh: 她带来一个预先整理好的文件夹，所有文件都按日期贴好标签。

examples.en: Using a preorganized schedule helps reduce stress during busy weeks.
examples.zh: 使用预先排好的日程表能在繁忙的几周里减轻压力。

extraExplanation: “preorganized”由前缀“pre-（预先）”+“organized（有条理的/整理好的）”构成，常用于强调“在开始之前就已经整理完成”。在更正式或学术写作里，也可能看到类似表达如“prearranged / preplanned / prestructured”。

summary.en: Preorganizing means organizing or planning something ahead of time.
summary.zh: preorganizing 指“提前组织/规划/准备”。

definition.en: (present participle of “preorganize”) arranging, planning, or setting up something in advance so it runs smoothly later.
definition.zh: （动词 preorganize 的现在分词）事先把事情安排、规划或准备好，以便之后更顺利地进行。

examples.en: We are preorganizing the seating chart to avoid confusion on the day of the event.
examples.zh: 我们正在提前安排座位表，避免活动当天混乱。

examples.en: Preorganizing your files can save you a lot of time later.
examples.zh: 提前整理文件可以为你之后省下很多时间。

definition.en: done in advance; used to describe planning or organizing that happens before the main activity.
definition.zh: 提前完成的；用于描述在主要活动开始前进行的规划或整理。

examples.en: The team used a preorganizing checklist before the conference.
examples.zh: 团队在会议前使用了一份提前准备的清单。

examples.en: Her preorganizing habits make group projects easier.
examples.zh: 她提前规划的习惯让小组项目更轻松。

extraExplanation: “preorganize / pre-organize”在日常英语里不算非常常见；更自然的表达常用“organize in advance / plan ahead / get things organized beforehand”。写作中也常见拼写为“pre-organizing”（加连字符）。

summary.en: “Preoriginal” (rare) means earlier than the original or an earliest accepted form.
summary.zh: “preoriginal”（罕用）指“比原版/原始形态更早的”。

definition.en: Existing or happening before the “original”; earlier than the earliest accepted version (rare).
definition.zh: （罕用）在“原始/原版”之前就已存在或发生的；比公认的最早版本还早的。

examples.en: The author found a preoriginal draft that shows how the story first took shape.
examples.zh: 作者找到了一份更早的草稿，显示这个故事最初是如何成形的。

examples.en: Some researchers argue there was a preoriginal form of the legend shared orally.
examples.zh: 一些研究者认为这个传说在口头传播阶段就有一个更早的形态。

extraExplanation: “preoriginal”在现代英语中非常少见，更多时候会写成“pre-original”，或直接用更常见、更自然的表达：earliest / prior / earlier version, proto-, preexisting 等。
词缀角度：pre- 表示“在……之前”，original 表示“原始的/原版的”。把两者合在一起，强调“比原版还早”。在学术语境（如文献学、神话学、版本学）偶尔会见到类似造词。

summary.en: “Preoriginally” is rare and nonstandard; it sometimes means “before the original version,” but it’s often a mistaken form of “previously” or “originally.”
summary.zh: “preoriginally”很少见且非标准；有时指“在原版之前”，但更常是把“previously（先前）”或“originally（最初）”写错了。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) Before the original version or source existed; at an earlier stage than what is considered the “original.”
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）在“原始版本/原始来源”出现之前；比被视为“原版”的阶段更早。

examples.en: In some editing notes, “pre-originally” is used to describe an earlier draft before the version treated as the original.
examples.zh: 在一些编辑说明里，“pre-originally”用来指被当作原版之前的更早草稿。

examples.en: The archive lists a pre-originally recorded outline that later became the main document.
examples.zh: 档案中列出了一份“原版”之前记录的提纲，后来发展成了正文。

definition.en: (Often a mistake) Used when someone actually means “previously,” “earlier,” or “originally.”
definition.zh: （常见为误用）有人用它其实想表达“先前/更早/最初”。

examples.en: Nonstandard: The file was preoriginally saved on my old laptop. (Better: previously/originally.)
examples.zh: 非标准：这个文件 preoriginally 保存在我的旧电脑里。（更好：previously/originally）

examples.en: Nonstandard: The song was preoriginally written for a movie. (Better: originally.)
examples.zh: 非标准：这首歌 preoriginally 为电影创作。（更好：originally）

extraExplanation: “preoriginally”几乎不出现在主流词典里；更常见的形式是带连字符的“pre-originally”，而且多见于学术写作、文本校勘或版本比较的语境，用来讨论“被当作原版之前的材料/阶段”。
如果你只是想说“先前”“更早”，通常用 previously / earlier；想说“最初/原本”，用 originally。

summary.en: Preornamental means “before ornamentation,” often used in archaeology, art history, or design to describe an early, undecorated stage.
summary.zh: preornamental 指“装饰之前的/装饰前阶段的”，常用于考古、艺术史或设计语境，强调发展早期尚未出现装饰。

definition.en: Existing before ornamentation or decorative details are added; relating to an early stage before something becomes decorative.
definition.zh: 装饰之前的；指在添加装饰细节之前的早期阶段。

examples.en: The architect showed a preornamental sketch to explain the building’s basic shape.
examples.zh: 建筑师展示了一张装饰前的草图，用来说明建筑的基本形状。

examples.en: Archaeologists described the pot as preornamental, made before the culture developed complex patterns.
examples.zh: 考古学家说这只陶罐属于装饰前阶段，制作时该文化尚未发展出复杂纹样。

definition.en: In art history or archaeology, describing a period or style that comes before a tradition of ornament or pattern becomes common.
definition.zh: （艺术史/考古）指某一时期或风格处在“尚未普遍发展装饰/纹样传统”的阶段。

examples.en: The exhibition moves from preornamental tools to highly decorated ceremonial objects.
examples.zh: 展览从装饰前的工具过渡到高度装饰的礼仪器物。

examples.en: Some scholars argue the settlement belonged to a preornamental phase of the region’s craft tradition.
examples.zh: 一些学者认为该聚落属于该地区工艺传统的装饰前阶段。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“ornamental”表示“装饰性的”。因此 preornamental 多用于学术语境（如考古、艺术史、设计过程），强调“时间/发展阶段在装饰出现之前”，而不只是“看起来朴素”。日常英语里更常说 unadorned（未加修饰的）或 plain（朴素的）。

summary.en: Presto means “suddenly/right away,” and it’s also used as a magician’s word and a music term meaning “very fast.”
summary.zh: Presto 表示“突然/立刻”，也可作魔术口头禅；在音乐中表示“极快”。

definition.en: (used to show something happens quickly or as if by magic) suddenly; right away.
definition.zh: （表示事情发生得很快或像变魔法一样）突然地；立刻。

examples.en: He typed a few keys and—presto—the file appeared.
examples.zh: 他敲了几下键盘——瞧，文件立刻就出现了。

examples.en: Add hot water, stir, and presto: instant soup.
examples.zh: 加热水、搅拌一下，瞧：速食汤就好了。

definition.en: a word said by performers to suggest a magic trick is happening.
definition.zh: （表演者用的）表示“变魔术啦”的口头禅。

examples.en: The magician waved the wand and said, “Presto!”
examples.zh: 魔术师挥了挥魔杖，说：“Presto！”

definition.en: (music) a tempo marking meaning “very fast.”
definition.zh: （音乐术语）速度记号，表示“极快”。

examples.en: This section is marked presto, so it should be played very fast.
examples.zh: 这一段标注为presto，所以要弹得很快。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“preost”很可能是拼写错误，常见正确拼写是“presto”。“presto”来自意大利语，在音乐里非常常见（如“Allegro”“Presto”等）。在日常英语中，它常用于轻松幽默的语气，表示“立刻就搞定/像变魔法一样”。

summary.en: Preotic means “in front of the ear,” mainly used in anatomy/biology.
summary.zh: preotic 指“耳前的/位于耳朵前方的”，主要用于解剖与生物学语境。

definition.en: (anatomy, biology) Located in front of the ear; relating to the area before the ear (especially in embryos or skull anatomy).
definition.zh: （解剖/生物）耳前的；位于耳朵前方的（尤用于胚胎或颅骨解剖位置描述）。

examples.en: In early development, several preotic structures form before the ear region is fully defined.
examples.zh: 在早期发育中，一些耳前结构会在耳区完全成形之前出现。

examples.en: The report describes a preotic swelling along the side of the head.
examples.zh: 报告描述了头部侧面出现的耳前肿胀。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前/在……前方”，“-otic”与“耳（ear）”相关（如 otic capsule 指“耳囊/耳部结构”）。因此 preotic 多用于学术语境，日常英语更常说 in front of the ear 或 preauricular（耳前的）。
容易与 prebiotic（益生元）混淆：prebiotic 是营养/肠道健康领域的常用词；preotic 则是解剖位置术语，含义不同。

summary.en: “Preoutfit” is an informal word for an outfit you plan or prepare ahead of time.
summary.zh: “preoutfit”是个非正式说法，指你提前想好或准备好的穿搭。

definition.en: (Informal) An outfit planned or prepared in advance, especially before an event (often used in fashion/social media contexts).
definition.zh: （非正式）提前搭配或准备好的穿搭，尤指为参加活动而事先想好的整套衣服（常见于时尚/社交媒体语境）。

examples.en: I always choose my preoutfit the night before a big meeting.
examples.zh: 重要会议前一晚我总会把预先搭好的穿搭选好。

examples.en: She posted her preoutfit ideas for the concert on TikTok.
examples.zh: 她在 TikTok 上发了音乐会的预先穿搭灵感。

definition.en: (Rare/Informal) To plan or pick an outfit in advance.
definition.zh: （较少见/非正式）提前规划或选定穿搭。

examples.en: We preoutfited for the wedding so we wouldn’t rush in the morning.
examples.zh: 我们为了婚礼提前把穿搭定好，这样早上就不用赶。

extraExplanation: “preoutfit”更像是网络造词/口语写法，常见形式也会写成“pre-outfit”或更自然地说“planned outfit / outfit planned in advance”。
在英语里“pre-”常作前缀表示“预先的”（如 pregame 赛前聚会、preorder 预订）。把它接到 outfit 上属于比较口语、社媒风格的用法，正式写作中建议换成更标准表达。

summary.en: “Preoutfitted” means already equipped in advance with needed items or features.
summary.zh: “preoutfitted”指“提前就已配齐所需装备或配置”。

definition.en: equipped or supplied in advance with the necessary items, features, or gear (often before delivery or before an activity begins).
definition.zh: 预先配备（装备/配置）好的；提前装配齐全的（常指在交付前或活动开始前就已准备好所需物品或功能）。

examples.en: The cabins come preoutfitted with basic cookware and bedding.
examples.zh: 这些小木屋在交付时就已经预先配好了基本的炊具和床品。

examples.en: We rented a preoutfitted van for the road trip, so we didn’t need to buy extra camping gear.
examples.zh: 我们租了一辆预先配齐装备的面包车去公路旅行，所以不用再买额外的露营装备。

examples.en: The lab ordered preoutfitted kits to make training new staff faster.
examples.zh: 实验室订购了预先配好的工具包，以加快新员工培训。

extraExplanation: “preoutfitted”由前缀 pre-（预先）+ outfit（配备装备）+ -ed 组成，常作形容词使用，语气偏书面或产品/商业描述。日常口语里也常用 “already equipped” 或 “fully equipped”。
拼写上也可能见到 “pre-outfitted”（带连字符）这一更清晰的写法，尤其在广告文案或技术说明中。

summary.en: Preoutfitting means pre-installing equipment and systems—especially in shipbuilding—before final assembly or launching.
summary.zh: Preoutfitting 指在最终总装或下水前（尤指造船）预先安装设备与系统的“预舾装”。

definition.en: the process of installing equipment, systems, or components into a structure (especially a ship) before the final assembly or before launching, so later work is faster and safer
definition.zh: （尤指造船中）在最终总装或下水之前，预先安装设备、系统或部件的过程；以便后续施工更快、更安全

examples.en: Preoutfitting allows crews to install pipes and cables while the ship sections are still easy to access.
examples.zh: 预舾装让工人在船体分段仍便于进入时就安装管路和电缆。

examples.en: The yard increased preoutfitting to reduce work done after the vessel was launched.
examples.zh: 船厂提高预舾装比例，以减少船舶下水后的施工量。

definition.en: to carry out preoutfitting work; to pre-install equipment or systems before final assembly (mainly used in technical writing)
definition.zh: 进行预舾装；在最终总装前预先安装设备或系统（多见于技术语境）

examples.en: They preoutfitted the engine room with major pumps before joining the hull blocks.
examples.zh: 他们在合拢分段前，先在机舱内预装了主要泵组。

examples.en: The modules are preoutfitted in the workshop and then lifted into place.
examples.zh: 这些模块在车间完成预装，然后吊装就位。

extraExplanation: “Preoutfitting”多用于造船/海工等行业，常与“block construction（分段建造）”一起出现：先在分段或模块阶段把管系、电缆桥架、阀门、通风、舾装件等装好，再进行合拢与总装。
相关常见指标：preoutfitting rate（预舾装率），指在总装前完成的舾装工作占比；提高预舾装率通常能缩短工期、降低高空/狭小空间作业风险。
词形上是 pre-（预先）+ outfitting（舾装/配装）。在一般日常英语中不常见，更多属于工程术语。

summary.en: “Preoutline” means to outline something in advance—to plan the main points before writing or presenting.
summary.zh: “preoutline”指在正式写作或展示之前先把要点列成提纲、提前规划结构。

definition.en: to make a rough outline in advance; to plan the main points before writing or presenting
definition.zh: （在正式写作或展示前）预先列提纲；先把要点大致规划出来

examples.en: Before she wrote the essay, she preoutlined her main arguments on a blank page.
examples.zh: 写论文前，她先在空白纸上预先列出了主要论点。

examples.en: Let’s preoutline the meeting agenda so we don’t miss anything.
examples.zh: 我们先把会议议程预先列个提纲，这样就不会漏掉内容。

examples.en: The teacher asked students to preoutline their stories before drafting.
examples.zh: 老师让学生在起草前先把故事预先列提纲。

extraExplanation: “preoutline”在现代英语里不算特别常见，更常见的表达是“outline first / make an outline beforehand / pre-plan the outline”。在正式写作中也常写作“pre-outline”（加连字符）。
词根拆解：pre- 表示“在……之前”，outline 表示“提纲/概述”。意思很直观：在正式展开之前先做一个大纲。

summary.en: Preoutlined means outlined in advance (or the past form of preoutline).
summary.zh: preoutlined 表示“事先列好提纲的”，也可作动词 preoutline 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (adj.) Already outlined or sketched in advance; having the main points planned before writing or doing something.
definition.zh: （形容词）事先已经列好提纲的；预先勾勒出要点的。

examples.en: The report followed a preoutlined structure, so it was easy to read.
examples.zh: 这份报告采用了事先列好的结构，所以很容易阅读。

examples.en: With a preoutlined lesson plan, the teacher moved smoothly from one topic to the next.
examples.zh: 有了预先写好的教学提纲，老师能很顺畅地从一个主题过渡到下一个。

definition.en: (v.) Simple past/past participle of preoutline: to outline something beforehand.
definition.zh: （动词）preoutline 的过去式/过去分词：在开始之前先为某事列提纲。

examples.en: She preoutlined her essay before writing the first paragraph.
examples.zh: 她在写第一段之前先把文章提纲列好了。

examples.en: We had preoutlined the meeting agenda, so the discussion stayed on track.
examples.zh: 我们事先拟好了会议议程，所以讨论没有跑题。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“预先、在……之前”（如 prepay 预付、preheat 预热）；“outline”是“提纲/概述”。所以“preoutlined”常用于写作、报告、课程设计等语境，强调“在正式开始前已把结构和要点搭好”。
在实际英语中，“preoutlined”不算特别常见；更常见的表达是“already outlined”“outlined in advance”或“a pre-written outline / an outline prepared in advance”。

summary.en: Preoutlining means outlining in advance to plan the structure before writing or presenting.
summary.zh: preoutlining 指在写作或演示前先预先列出结构大纲。

definition.en: the act of making an outline in advance (before writing, speaking, designing, or planning something)
definition.zh: 预先列大纲；在开始写作/演讲/设计/规划之前先做框架

examples.en: Preoutlining helps me organize my ideas before I start writing the essay.
examples.zh: 预先列大纲能帮助我在开始写论文前把想法整理清楚。

examples.en: The team did some preoutlining to decide the main points for the presentation.
examples.zh: 团队先预先列大纲，确定演示的要点。

definition.en: to outline in advance; to sketch the main structure before working in detail
definition.zh: 预先概述；在展开细节之前先勾勒主要结构

examples.en: I preoutlined the report so each section would have a clear purpose.
examples.zh: 我先把报告预先列了大纲，这样每一部分都有明确目的。

examples.en: Before filming, the director preoutlined the story beats for each scene.
examples.zh: 开拍前，导演先把每个场景的关键情节点预先列出来。

extraExplanation: “preoutlining”不是特别常见的固定词，更多时候人们会说“make an outline first / outline in advance / create a preliminary outline”。在学术写作、商业写作和内容创作中，这个动作很常见：先确定主题、主论点和分段结构，再补充证据与细节。

summary.en: “Preoverthrew” is not a standard word; it likely means “previously/had overthrown.” The standard form is “overthrew,” past tense of “overthrow.”
summary.zh: “preoverthrew”不是标准用词，多半想表达“先前/已经推翻”。标准形式是“overthrew”，为“overthrow（推翻/打翻）”的过去式。

definition.en: Nonstandard/rare form: usually read as “pre- + overthrew,” meaning “overthrew earlier/before something else.” In normal English, people would simply say “had overthrown” or “previously overthrew.”
definition.zh: 非标准/罕见形式：通常可理解为“pre-（在……之前）+ overthrew（推翻）”，表示“更早/在某事之前就推翻了”。日常英语更常说“had overthrown”或“previously overthrew”。

examples.en: By the time the rebels arrived, the army had already overthrown the governor.
examples.zh: 叛军到达时，军队已经推翻了总督。

examples.en: If you mean “preoverthrew,” it’s clearer to write “previously overthrew” in an essay.
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“preoverthrew”，在作文里写“previously overthrew（先前推翻）”会更清楚。

definition.en: Past tense of “overthrow”: to remove a ruler/government from power by force.
definition.zh: “overthrow”的过去式：用武力推翻统治者或政府，使其下台。

examples.en: The revolution overthrew the king in 1911.
examples.zh: 1911年的革命推翻了国王。

examples.en: They tried to overthrow the regime, but failed.
examples.zh: 他们试图推翻政权，但失败了。

definition.en: Past tense of “overthrow”: to defeat completely or knock down/turn over.
definition.zh: “overthrow”的过去式：彻底击败；（把东西）打翻、掀翻。

examples.en: The champion was overthrown by a younger fighter.
examples.zh: 冠军被一位更年轻的选手击败了。

examples.en: The strong wind overthrew several trees.
examples.zh: 大风刮倒了好几棵树。

extraExplanation: “pre-”作前缀常表示“在……之前”（如 prewar 战前、preexisting 先前存在的）。但把“pre-”直接加在一个过去式动词 overthrew 前面几乎不这么用，所以“preoverthrew”看起来更像拼写错误或临时造词。
如果你想表达“在更早之前就已经推翻”，英语更自然的表达是：had overthrown（过去完成时）、previously/earlier overthrew（副词修饰）、the pre-overthrow period（名词短语：推翻前时期）。

summary.en: Preoverthrow means ‘before an overthrow,’ often describing the time or conditions before a regime or leader was removed.
summary.zh: preoverthrow 意为“政权/统治者被推翻之前的”，常用来描述被推翻前的时期或状况。

definition.en: Existing, happening, or referring to the period before a government or ruler is overthrown.
definition.zh: 指在（政府或统治者）被推翻之前的；发生在推翻之前的。

examples.en: The museum has photos from the preoverthrow era.
examples.zh: 博物馆里有一些来自政权被推翻之前时期的照片。

examples.en: Preoverthrow policies were very different from what came after the revolution.
examples.zh: 推翻之前的政策与革命之后的政策非常不同。

definition.en: (More generally) Happening before a major removal or defeat of a person in power (not necessarily a government).
definition.zh: （更广义）指在掌权者被赶下台或失势之前的（不一定是政府层面）。

examples.en: In the biography, the author compares his preoverthrow and postoverthrow leadership styles.
examples.zh: 在传记中，作者比较了他下台前与下台后的领导风格。

extraExplanation: “preoverthrow”不是非常常见的标准词，更多是写作中为强调时间顺序而临时组合出来的形容词（pre- + overthrow）。在正式写作里也常用更自然的表达，如“before the overthrow / prior to the overthrow / pre-coup / pre-revolutionary”。

summary.en: “Preoverthrowing” means “before an overthrow,” but it’s uncommon; “pre-overthrow” or “before the overthrow” is more natural.
summary.zh: “preoverthrowing”大致表示“推翻之前的”，但不常用；更自然的是“pre-overthrow”或“before the overthrow”。

definition.en: Happening or existing before an overthrow (the removal of a government by force or sudden change).
definition.zh: 发生在政权被推翻之前的；推翻前的（指以武力或突变方式更换政府之前的时期/状态）。

examples.en: The museum has a section on preoverthrowing politics and daily life.
examples.zh: 博物馆有一个展区介绍推翻前的政治与日常生活。

examples.en: Preoverthrowing tensions were already visible in the streets.
examples.zh: 在推翻之前，街头的紧张气氛就已显现。

definition.en: The act or process of overthrowing something, viewed as being planned or prepared in advance (rare; usually written with a hyphen).
definition.zh: 预先策划/准备推翻某事的行为或过程（较少见；通常会写成带连字符的形式）。

examples.en: They were accused of pre-overthrowing planning against the regime.
examples.zh: 他们被指控预先策划推翻该政权。

examples.en: Most writers would say “planning an overthrow” rather than “preoverthrowing.”
examples.zh: 大多数写作者会说“策划推翻（planning an overthrow）”，而不是“preoverthrowing”。

extraExplanation: “preoverthrowing”不是很常见的标准词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-overthrow”作定语（如：pre-overthrow government / pre-overthrow period），或直接用“before the overthrow”。
构词上是前缀“pre-（在……之前）”+ “overthrow（推翻）”。在学术写作、新闻或历史叙述中，为了清晰与正式，通常会优先选择“pre-overthrow + 名词”。

summary.en: Pre-overthrown means “from the period before a regime or ruler was overthrown.”
summary.zh: pre-overthrown 指“政权/统治者被推翻之前那段时期的（推翻前的）”。

definition.en: (Rare, usually written with a hyphen: pre-overthrown) Describing something that existed or happened before a government/ruler/system was overthrown.
definition.zh: （较少见，通常写作 pre-overthrown）形容某个事物发生在政权/统治者/制度被推翻之前；即“推翻前的”。

examples.en: The museum has a small collection of pre-overthrown royal portraits.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆收藏了一小批政权被推翻前的王室肖像。

examples.en: She studied pre-overthrown laws to understand what changed after the revolution.
examples.zh: 她研究了政权被推翻前的法律，以了解革命后发生了哪些变化。

extraExplanation: “preoverthrown”本身并不是常见的标准拼写，更自然的写法是加连字符：pre-overthrown，意思是“在（某政权）被推翻之前的”。
英语里 pre- 常用来构成“……之前的”形容词（如 prewar 战前的、precolonial 殖民前的）。overthrown 是 overthrow 的过去分词，常见搭配是 “the overthrown regime（被推翻的政权）”。把二者合起来用于修饰名词时，加连字符更清晰。

summary.en: Preoviposition means the time period before an animal (often an insect) starts laying eggs.
summary.zh: preoviposition 指（常見於昆蟲）開始產卵之前的那段時間。

definition.en: (Biology) The period of time before an animal—especially an insect—begins laying eggs (oviposition).
definition.zh: （生物學）產卵前期；指動物（尤其是昆蟲）開始產卵（oviposition）之前的一段時間。

examples.en: The preoviposition period in this moth lasts about three days after mating.
examples.zh: 這種蛾在交配後的產卵前期大約持續三天。

examples.en: Temperature can shorten the preoviposition period and increase egg-laying sooner.
examples.zh: 溫度可能縮短產卵前期，讓產卵更早開始。

extraExplanation: 這個詞多見於昆蟲學、寄生蜂研究、害蟲生態與繁殖生物學。研究者常用「preoviposition period（產卵前期）」來描述成蟲羽化後到第一次產卵之間的時間，或交配後到開始產卵的時間（依研究定義而定）。
字面結構：pre-（在……之前）+ oviposition（產卵）。在論文或報告中常與 fecundity（繁殖力/產卵量）、longevity（壽命）、oviposition rate（產卵速率）一起討論。

summary.en: Preovulatory means ‘before ovulation,’ often used in medical or fertility contexts.
summary.zh: preovulatory 指“排卵前的”，常用于医学或生育相关语境。

definition.en: Happening before ovulation (the release of an egg from the ovary).
definition.zh: 排卵前的；发生在排卵（卵子从卵巢释放）之前的。

examples.en: Some people notice mild cramping during the preovulatory phase.
examples.zh: 有些人在排卵前阶段会感觉到轻微的腹部痉挛。

examples.en: Doctors may monitor preovulatory follicles during fertility treatment.
examples.zh: 在生育治疗中，医生可能会监测排卵前的卵泡。

extraExplanation: 医学语境中常说“preovulatory phase（排卵前期）”，大致对应月经周期中从月经结束到排卵发生之前的一段时间；此时通常以卵泡发育和雌激素逐渐升高为特征。
也常见搭配：preovulatory follicle（排卵前卵泡）、preovulatory surge（排卵前激增，常指LH激增前后的阶段）。
